page.title: 02HANDICAPPED SPORTS CENTRE
page.content: This sports centre is special because it is for disabled as well as able- bodied people. It was the dream of Len Tasker, himself disabled. A disused warehouse was bought and it cost Â£400,000 to transform it. The money was raised by funds and donations, with one donation of Â£10 coming from as far away as the Bahamas. The centre was opened on October 25th 1984. Inside there is a gymnasium equipped with a variety of special equipment. In two other large halls there are facilities for archery, cricket, badminton, table tennis, pool, trampolining and gymnastics. In the snooker room one table is especially designed so it can be used easily by people in wheelchairs. The most expensive part of the sports centre for the disabled is the indoor bowling green which cost Â£22,000 to complete.
